patch.data: Greetings all! We have come to our 4th patch here in Dawngate, and it's a big one! The much requested feature of Matchmaking has been added! It is still in it's infancy, and, being a closed beta, we expect any and all feedback for the system to be submitted to us through the Survey feature in the front-end client! Also introduced: the Shaper Gallery! A way to view Shapers Lore, Stats, and Abilities outside of the game! Enjoy, and happy playing!
New Feature: Matchmaking

Developer Note: This implementation of matchmaking is part one of this feature. As the beta continues, we'll be regularly iterating on the algorithm and adding new features and functionality to it. With this initial version we are introducing a matchmaking rating to everyone for the first time. Since there was no prior rating up until this point it will take several games before the system has an understanding of your skill level. Due to this, we ask that you please be patient and proactive about giving us feedback about the system and your experience.

When pressing the "Play" button in the front-end client, players will be presented with 3 options:
  • Solo - Allows a single player to be matched with other players of a similar skill level to enjoy a game of Dawngate
  • Group - Allows multiple people to queue up together and find a game against similarly skilled opponents. This supports 2 to 5 man pre-made groups
  • Custom - You may create or join a custom game through a lobby system.
New Feature: Shaper Gallery

• In the front-end client players may now view the abilities and lores of each Shaper in the brand new Shaper Gallery. Shapers are rated in this gallery based on their proficiencies in various areas (pushing, disabling, etc.) This gallery may be accessed by clicking the "Shapers" tab in the front-end client.

Balance and Tuning

Shapers

• Unyielding Progress (E)
    • Added text to the level up tooltip on this ability to correctly display the amount of slowing effect reduced by this ability at each rank.
Map

Lane Minions
  • Ranged lane minions have had their base experience increased to 28, up from 21.5.
  • Ranged lane minions have had their experience per level decreased to 2.25, down from 3.
  • Melee lane minions have had their base experience increased to 58, up from 45.
  • Melee lane minions have had their experience per level decreased to 4.7, down from 6.27.

Spirit Wells
  • The Spirit Wells will now initially unlock 10 minutes into the game, up from 7.5 minutes.
Spells

Developer Note: Dispel is a powerful but tricky defensive option--it allows you to respond to an enemy's disabling or debuffing effects after they're applied rather than before, then either counterattack or slip away with the brief speed boost it provides. However, Dispel can be a risky option compared to other defensive or utility spells: Bastion or Deflect might be enough to negate the damage you suffer while disabled, for example, or the superior mobility provided by Blink might allow you to avoid being disabled in the first place. Dispel is best used when you know you can't avoid an enemy with powerful disables, or when you know you'll only need a few steps of speed to reposition for a counterattack.New Spell
  • This new spell instantly remove all debuffs and disables (except suppression) from your shaper, and then reduce the duration of incoming disables for a short period afterward. If Dispel successfully removes a debuff or disable, you gain a brief but powerful Movement Speed increase.

Developer Note: Stagger has been changed to have its duration scale with distance from the target--distant foes are slowed longer, while nearby foes are slowed for a shorter duration. This change is to help Stagger further stand out as a strong initiation/chasing spell, as opposed to Wither's focus on turning the tide of close-range fights
  • The duration of the slow from Stagger has been changed from a flat 2 second slow, to a 1-3 second slow depending on distance from affected target. It will act as a longer duration slow against a target hit by this ability at further range, and a shorter duration slow against a target hit by this ability at a shorter range.
General Fixes / Updates

Front-End Client
  • Removed the notifications in General Chat every time someone left or joined the group. This should alleviate the clutter, and make General Chat more usable by players.

General
  • Fixed a crash that was triggered during a specific audio event.

Item Shop
  • Fixed an issue where items and filters didn't re-populate as expected when clearing previously checked filters.

Keybindings
  • Right mouse button is now a bindable key. By default, right mouse button will be used to issue move commands. Attack moving is now, by default, shift + right mouse button.

Login
  • Added an option to mute the login music when at the front-end login screen.

UI
  • Added new cursor icons for the "Attack" and "Place Ward" commands.
